August 2025 Update.title: NGIAB Journal Paper
August 2025 Update.description:
🎉We are excited to announce that our NGIAB paper 'NextGen In A Box (NGIAB): Open-Source Containerization of the NextGen Framework to Enable Community-Driven Hydrology Modeling' has been accepted for publication in Environmental Modelling and Software! 

The paper is now available online and can be accessed [here](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1364815225003500).

August 2025 Update.title: NGIAB-data-preprocess
August 2025 Update.description: A new release of ngiab_data_preprocess, version v4.5.0, is now available! Preprocessing support for the LSTM model has now been integrated, making LSTM-based NGIAB configurations far more accessible.

August 2025 Update.title: NGIAB-CloudInfra
August 2025 Update.description: NGIAB version 1.5.0 is available now. This update restricts searches for realization.json to the config folder. Additionally, the LSTM model has been integrated into the NGIAB image, enabling AI-powered hydrologic prediction.

August 2025 Update.title: NGIAB-HPCInfra
August 2025 Update.description: NGIAB-HPCInfra version 1.1.0 is available now. This update brings parity with NGIAB-CloudInfra's recent changes, including full support for LSTM-based models.

August 2025 Update.title: ngen-datastream
August 2025 Update.description:
ngen-datastream is now known as the **NextGen Research DataStream (NRDS)**! We hope to continue using this platform to advance the boundaries of continental-scale modeling.

Release v1.1.0 recently released! Major enhancements include implementation of medium range ensemble members in DataStreamCLI and NRDS infrastructure, enhanced metadata and CI/CD with semantic versioning implementation, development towards automated testing and production deployment, the DataStreamCLI skip feature, increased test coverage, and documentation updates.

August 2025 Update.title: CIROH-UA/ngen
August 2025 Update.description: Upstream updates to BMI submodules have been merged! The CFE module has fixes to volume start and pointer handling, and the LSTM module has been updated to fully incorporate the CIROH community fork.

August 2025 Update.title: CIROH-UA/t-route
August 2025 Update.description: Version v0.2.0 of CIROH-UA/t-route is available now. This marks the formal release of last month's memory and performance improvements.

July 2025 Update.title: NGIAB-data-preprocess
July 2025 Update.description: A new release of ngiab_data_preprocess, version v4.4.0, is now available!🎉 This update includes several improvements and bug fixes. Notable changes include a warning prompt that now displays when attempting to overwrite subset gpkg files, and the graph pickle file download has been integrated with the hf download process. Additionally, a missing scipy dependency has been added. Performance enhancements include estimating t-route RAM usage to create parquet files accordingly, and forcing interpolation now works without requiring a dask cluster. The CLI experience has also been improved with the download dashboard URL now being printed during execution.

July 2025 Update.title: NGIAB-CloudInfra
July 2025 Update.description: This month's updates for NGIAB-CloudInfra consist mostly of documentation improvements. The primary focus was updating information on the Provo River basin case study, with comprehensive details including calibration files, input data, and setup information now accessible through the [HydroShare resource page](https://www.hydroshare.org/resource/88e0ebf2719c492381efcb27fba71032/). New documentation has been added to the [docs folder](https://github.com/CIROH-UA/NGIAB-CloudInfra/tree/main/docs). Additionally, the output folder path description in `runteehr.sh` has been corrected to improve clarity. This month also saw significant activity with the docker pull count for awiciroh/ciroh-ngen-image, though many of these pulls are attributed to internal runs due to frequent building and updates of the image.

July 2025 Update.title: ngen-datastream
July 2025 Update.description: Release 1.0.0 and Release 1.0.1 recently released in July! Initial stable release of the Research DataStream infrastructure and DataStreamCLI workflow tool for automated NextGen hydrologic simulations. Release 1.0.1 captures metadata related improvements. Moreover, July's developments were focused on reproducibility by implementing the creation of two files on each execution. The first file, datastream.env, can be used to identically reproduce a datastream execution via the CONF_FILE argument and the second file, datastream_steps.txt, lists every relevant internal command datastream makes. The intention for these files is to make it easier for community members to first reproduce research datastream executions and then begin improving the NextGen configuration and contributing their findings back to the system.

July 2025 Update.title: ngiab-cal
July 2025 Update.description: A new release of ngiab-cal, version v0.3.3, is now available. This update includes several important fixes and improvements. The observation unit has been corrected to cms, and the system now prevents auto-running when the configuration has not been updated. Additionally, build and release GitHub actions have been added to streamline the development workflow.

July 2025 Update.title: CIROH-UA/t-route
July 2025 Update.description: This month's updates for T-route focused on performance optimization. Memory usage has been reduced by 30% when writing output, which means it is less likely to crash during large runs that don't use intermediate parquet files.

June 2025 Update.title: NGIAB-data-preprocess
June 2025 Update.description:
A new release of ngiab_data_preprocess, version **v4.3.0**, is now available. This update primarily includes small improvements and bug fixes. Among the more noticeable changes, the map application can now display data source chunking. Additionally, missing values in the AORC forcing data will now be filled using interpolation. 
 
 Beyond these changes, an **'alias'** for ngiab_data_preprocess has been created. This allows users to execute the command-line interface (CLI) more concisely, for example, using `uvx ngiab-prep -i cat-123` instead of the longer `uvx --from ngiab_data_preprocess cli -i cat-123`. This alias functions as a separate pip package that simply depends on ngiab_data_preprocess.

June 2025 Update.title: ngen-datastream
June 2025 Update.description:
For this month, we primarily focused on cleaning up the code and updating to the **latest Python version, 3.12**. In terms of system operations, we have scaled back to **VPU16** and are now exclusively running only VPU16. 
 
 It's been observed that the NWM analysis_assim_extend forcings are intermittent, which is causing similar intermittent behavior in the analogous datastream runs.

May 2025 Update.title: CIROH Developer's Conference 2025: NextGen Workshops
May 2025 Update.description:
📚 Content from many of DevCon2025's workshops has been made publicly available! Links to several of them are provided below.

> *Note that some workshops made use of resources that were deployed specifically during DevCon. However, their steps should still work when adapted for local installations.*

- [Navigating the NextGen Ecosystem and NextGen In A Box (NGIAB)](https://github.com/CIROH-UA/Conferences/blob/main/CIROHDevCon2025/CIROH%20Community%20NextGen%202025_Final.pdf)
- [BMI Basics for NGIAB](https://github.com/CIROH-UA/Conferences/blob/main/CIROHDevCon2025/BMI%20Basics%20Workshop.md)
- [Output visualization through Tethys and evaluation customization using TEEHR](https://github.com/CIROH-UA/Conferences/blob/main/CIROHDevCon2025/OutputVisualizationThroughTethysAndTEEHREvaluation_DevCon2025_IntroSlides.pdf)
- [NextGen Calibration Workshop](https://github.com/skoriche/NGIAB-Calibration-DevCon25/blob/main/README.md)
- [NextGen Research Datastream: How to Contribute to Improving NextGen Forecasts](https://github.com/CIROH-UA/Conferences/blob/main/CIROHDevCon2025/ResearchDataStream_workshop.md) ([Slides](https://github.com/CIROH-UA/Conferences/blob/main/CIROHDevCon2025/ResearchDataStream_presentation.pdf))
- [Working with HydroShare, AORC data, HydroFabric and NextGen on CIROH JupyterHub](https://www.hydroshare.org/resource/fc8539358fe64ca6a47468728a0687a1/)

May 2025 Update.title: CIROH-2i2c JupyterHub: New NextGen National Water Model Image
May 2025 Update.description: 🚀 The NextGen In A Box ecosystem is now available for use on CIROH-2i2c JupyterHub! Select the "NextGen National Water Model (NWM)" image to get started.

April 2025 Update.title: New NGIAB-Calibration Feature🎉
April 2025 Update.description:
⚙️ Major update to NextGen In A Box! It now supports extended calibration for CFE and NOAA OWP modules. The new calibration framework provides more flexible parameter tuning and improved model performance.

👨‍💻 Uses ngen-cal branch: [https://github.com/CIROH-UA/ngen-cal/tree/ngiab_cal](https://github.com/CIROH-UA/ngen-cal/tree/ngiab_cal) 

📖 For detailed instructions on how to use the new calibration capabilities, please check out: [https://github.com/CIROH-UA/ngen-cal/tree/ngiab_cal#how-to-use-this](https://github.com/CIROH-UA/ngen-cal/tree/ngiab_cal#how-to-use-this)
![A snaphot of the NGIAB CLI's "guide.sh" script.](/img/news/April-2025-ngiab-cli.png)

April 2025 Update.title: New NextGen In A Box Product Website
April 2025 Update.description:
🎉 We're excited to announce the launch of our new NGIAB dedicated website! Visit our NGIAB webiste at [https://ngiab.ciroh.org/](https://ngiab.ciroh.org/) to explore all NGIAB tools, documentation, and resources all in one place.
 
 ![NGIAB Website Image](/img/news/April-2025-ngiab-website.png)

April 2025 Update.title: NGIAB 101 Training Module Now Available
April 2025 Update.description:
📚 The new NGIAB 101 training module is now available with comprehensive documentation, installation guides, and step-by-step instructions for the complete NGIAB end-to-end workflow. It is perfect for new users and those looking to deepen their understanding of the platform. 
 
 ![NGIAB 101 Image](/img/news/April-2025-ngiab-101.png)

April 2025 Update.title: Datastream Visualization: NGIAB-client (Visualizer) v0.1.3 released
April 2025 Update.description:
🚀 The visualizer now includes DataStream S3 bucket visualization, which allows users to download data from DataStream S3 bucket and visualize data directly. The new update improves time series data handling, fixes some graph display issues and ensures proper datastream-ensemble associations. 
 
 ![Datastream Visualization](/img/news/April-2025-datastream-vis.png)

April 2025 Update.title: NGIAB-CloudInfra: New and improved shell scripts
April 2025 Update.description: ✨ The shell scripts in NGIAB have gotten a new look! The entire NGIAB workflow has been polished for a clean, intuitive experience.

March 2025 Update.title: NGIAB-data-preprocess
March 2025 Update.description:
#### 🚀 New Release v4.0.5!
 
 This month's update focuses on speed and reliability! We've improved initial setup times by switching to `boto3` for slightly faster S3 hydrofabric downloads. Plus, we've resolved map display issues by updating our JavaScript dependencies. 
 
 🔥A new image of NGIAB-data-preprocess is now available in the [CIROH 2i2c JupyterHub](https://ciroh.awi.2i2c.cloud/hub/login) production environment. 
 
 ![NGIAB-Preprocess Image](/img/news/March-2025-ngiab-preprocess-jupyterhub-image.png)

March 2025 Update.description:

New calibrated dataset added for Provo River near Woodland, UT AWI_16_10154200_009.tar.gz in README at the link below. Also available in HydroShare!!! 
 
  The new script - runTeehr.sh now available to run NGIAB-TEEHR Evaluation on both ARM64 and AMD64 platforms.

March 2025 Update.title: Updated Community NextGen Documentation Page
March 2025 Update.description:
📢 We've new updates under Community NextGen products tab. 📚 This comprehensive resource includes an overview of NGIAB and its extensions.
 - 🔍 Learn more about Data Preprocess, TEEHR Evaluation, Data Visualizer, and DataStreamCLI. 
 - 🛠️ Key features, Capabilities and Access Method are included.

March 2025 Update.title: ngen-datastream
March 2025 Update.description: ✨ Added CIROH Community Hydrofabric Testing! Automated CI tests are added for each VPU to ensure the geopackage is compatible with DataStreamCLI, NextGen and NGIAB.

March 2025 Update.title: NGIAB-HPCInfra: NGIAB Singularity Image for HPC!
March 2025 Update.description:
✨ March updates include 2 PRs:

 - Synced the NGIAB HPC singularity image with the latest features from NGIAB docker image .

March 2025 Update.title: Community FIM Documentation on DocuHub
March 2025 Update.description: 📢 Both FIM as a service (FIMserv) and FIM Evaluation Framework (FIMPEF) documentation now available on DocuHub!! Go to Products tab -> Community Flood Inundation Mapping

March 2025 Update.title: CIROH Portal New Look!!
March 2025 Update.description: 📢 BYU Team released newer version of CIROH Portal using docusaurus framework. This brings consistency with CIROH DocuHub!

March 2025 Update.title: DocuHub Contribute page Updated
March 2025 Update.description: 📢 For more ways to contribute to DocuHub. Read below

February 2025 Update.title: NGIAB-data-preprocess
February 2025 Update.description: 🚀 New Release v4.0.3! February brings exciting enhancements to our data preprocessing tool! We've now integrated AORC as an additional data source option for forcings. The codebase has been thoroughly refactored to simplify future integration of new gridded data sources. This architectural improvement makes the tool more extensible and easier to maintain going forward.

February 2025 Update.title: NGIAB-CloudInfra: NGIAB Docker Image
February 2025 Update.description: 🔥 New Release v1.4.2! Our February update delivers significant improvements to the NGIAB Docker image! The container now incorporates the latest code from CIROH-UA/ngen:ngiab and CIROH-UA/t-route:ngiab branches. We've updated CFE and Noah-OWP-Modular to their latest versions, removed the GDAL dependency to streamline the image, and implemented remoteless partitioning for enhanced parallel performance.

February 2025 Update.title: ngen-datastream
February 2025 Update.description: ✨ Community Research Tools Now Public! The terraform configurations and executions for the community Research Datastream in AWS are now publicly available in the ngen-datastream repository (path: research_datastream/terraform_community). We've also added an interactive text-based graphical interface script to guide new users through the Datastream CLI tool (path: scripts/datastream_guide), making the onboarding experience more intuitive.

February 2025 Update.title: NGIAB-HPCInfra: NGIAB Singularity Image
February 2025 Update.description: ⚡ Critical HPC Fix Deployed! The NGIAB Singularity Image now leverages the latest code from CIROH-UA/ngen:ngiab and CIROH-UA/t-route:ngiab branches. A critical pull request was merged to resolve the 'srun permission denied' issue on HPC compute nodes by transitioning to OpenMPI. This fix has been successfully validated on both the Pantarhei and Anvil clusters, ensuring smooth operation in HPC environments.

February 2025 Update.title: CIROH-UA/ngen:ngiab
February 2025 Update.description: ✨ Performance Optimization Update! The NGIAB-CloudInfra and NGIAB-HPCInfra containers now utilize our optimized ngiab branch of CIROH-UA/ngen. T-route performance has been significantly enhanced for parallel execution with an alternative partitioning scheme specifically optimized for single-machine parallel runs. Additionally, we've introduced new configuration options that allow users to disable netCDF forcing caching and catchment output writing for more flexible deployment scenarios.

February 2025 Update.title: CIROH-UA/t-route:ngiab
February 2025 Update.description: ✨ 3x Faster Performance! The NGIAB-CloudInfra and NGIAB-HPCInfra containers now incorporate our optimized ngiab branch of CIROH-UA/t-route. We've drastically improved t-route output writing efficiency, resulting in approximately three times faster performance. This enhancement significantly reduces processing time for hydrological simulations.

December 2024 Update.title: NGIAB-data-preprocess
December 2024 Update.description: Pro Tip: The data-preprocess tool offers VPU subsetting capabilities and can generate configuration files for empirical models like the 'Demonstration LSTM'. Check out these and other new features in the latest release! Discover more updates here.

December 2024 Update.title: NGIAB-CloudInfra: NGIAB Docker Image
December 2024 Update.description: Version 1.4.0 is now available! This release introduces the “demonstration LSTM” within NGIAB, along with sample AWI-008 input data. The LSTM model serves as an educational example to help users get started, though it’s not optimized for maximum prediction accuracy.” Explore more updates here.

December 2024 Update.description: Important Update: Datastream has been upgraded to v2.2 hydrofabric and now generates both NextGen outputs and forcings for VPUs 02, 03W, and 16. For more details, visit the Datastream portal at https://datastream.ciroh.org/index.html

The scripts and plotting tools were developed to perform benchmarking and preliminary results have been collected.

Feb 2024 Update.title: Improvement of NGIAB CI Pipeline for Pull Requests from Forked Repositories
Feb 2024 Update.description: Three pull requests have been successfully merged. Pull requests submitted using forked repositories are now automatically tested in the CI Pipeline. Upon merging changes to the main repository, another CI pipeline is triggered to retest the build and push the image to DockerHub. Additionally, new AWI_004 sample data is now available for 09 VPU for unit testing.

Nov 2023 Update.title: Hydrofabric
Nov 2023 Update.description: Lynker is proud to support CIROH with a freely accessable resource for geospatial data: https://www.lynker-spatial.com/. Updated hfsubset to support using the v2.0 hydrofabric by default. Added Cross-section support to the hydrofabric. 13 PRs merged in November. Added additional json/geojson support

Nov 2023 Update.title: NextGen Framework Forcings
Nov 2023 Update.description: 14 PRs merged towards the Research Data Stream. Fixed lingering pyarrow issues. Added new support for all segments to be dockerized. Added S3 support with regards to the control flow design, to support one reusable, configurable  sequence

Nov 2023 Update.title: Community Support
Nov 2023 Update.description: Singularity support is coming to AWI for HPC users that are able to run Singularity builds. Work on serialization (passing from one run to the next with model states still in memory or imported from a file) is ongoing, relative temporal configurations of NextGen with consideration to model configuration changes between timesteps, and better general support for framework polymorphism.

Oct 2023 Update.title: NGIAB Updates
Oct 2023 Update.description: 15 runs of the whole build process, 7 successful, and 2 pending. Over 550 pulls of the container image, number of 'canonical' runs (uploading their metadata and results) is coming in a future version.

Oct 2023 Update.title: NextGen Model Framework
Oct 2023 Update.description: Updates to SUMMA candidate model, performance improvements for memory usage and spatial domain tooling to decouple the currently used geojson Feature and geometry classes into their own simple features interface. This is an abstract interface, with a coupled Boost.Geometry backend that will be used as the default backend.

Oct 2023 Update.title: T-route
Oct 2023 Update.description: 22 Pull Requests were worked on in October with 11 merged, and a focus on testing and getting the compiling process to be tested and reliable particularly for downstream NGIAB and HPC usage of t-route
